intro: Aldama phenax, commonly known as the Mexican yellowwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has a woody stem with a rough, fissured bark that becomes more prominent with age. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
